isis.stitle: New Vehicle Loss and Damage Procedures Manual - Salvage

svcproc.title: Salvage
svcproc.para: Carriers are entitled to recover parts that must be replaced when a vehicle is repaired and a claim is filed. These parts must be made available to the carrier as salvage upon request. Numerous parts may be requested by the carrier for salvage purposes. These parts may be identified after a claim is processed, the Next Day Scrap Report will have "HOLD PARTS" listed and the WPII screen will have an "H" listed for parts return. This is an indicator that you should hold the parts and await further instruction on salvage request from the carrier.
In order to minimize the length of time a dealer must hold these items, these procedures listed below are to be followed:

step1.para: Immediately after a vehicle has been repaired, prepare and submit a claim to International Warranty Center via DDEW.

The carrier must advise the dealer of parts disposition within 30 days via letter after the claim is received. If the dealer is not notified within 30 days from the process date of the claim, the parts may be discarded.
